column2: In the Reformation, the Catholic Christian Church split into the Catholic Church and various Protestant Churches.
Martin Luther was a German Catholic priest who began the Reformation in 1527, eventually establishing the Lutheran religion.
Protestants are Christians who are not Catholics. They broke from the Catholic Church and “protested” against the Church.

column1: 4. What is the Protestant Work Ethic?
column2: The Protestant work ethic is a belief of Protestants that if a person works hard God will shower him with blessings.

column1: 5. What is religious freedom and in which American colonies was it practiced?
column2: In Rhode Island, Pennsylvania, and Maryland, colonists could practice any Christian religion they wanted.
The Enlightenment was a European intellectual movement that emphasized the importance of reason and individualism.
Some philosophers argue that natural rights are those that God created each person with: the rights to life, liberty, and the right to private property.
Locke was an English writer who wrote extensively about natural rights.
Smith was an English writer who wrote about capitalism. He is called the father of modern capitalism.
Capitalism is an economic model where individuals have freedom to make financial decisions and the government does not try to control their actions.
The Renaissance was a rebirth of classical Greek and Roman thought and art in Europe. It marks the end of the Medieval Ages.

column1: 12. What was the Age of Exploration?
column2: In the 1400s-1700s, Europeans explored and colonized much of the world.

column1: 13. Who was Prince Henry the Navigator?
column2: This Portuguese Prince sponsored Europeans to explore and map the world.
Diaz was the first to sail around the southern tip of Africa.
Vasco de Gama was the first to sail to India and back to Portugal.
